SPARK MHS Teacher Grants Fall 2015

Tadd Scott

The Need

Tadd writes, “There will be a full-on residency with American Conservatory Theater in the Drama Department Fall 2015 and Spring 2016. The artist will support the teacher with curriculum and supporting students with productions in the Fall and Spring. A.C.T.will pay the TA for prep time to create the c urriculum and we would fund the TA’s time working with students on production, writing, and performance. We will produce and perform at least one production together.”

Mission High Student Benefit

The students in the program are described as “diverse and collaborative”. In addition to supporting the Drama class directly this grant will also begin a partnership with the A.C.T. that can be sustained and developed over time. The grant is intended to help foster joyful learners who want to learn all about the business of theater and to perform. The grant will help Mission to open pathways for post-secondary internships, education, and employment opportunities in the Theater Arts.

SPARK Grant Award

$1,500 to fund a 10-week residency with an A.C.T. Teaching Artist.

Tara Freedman

The Need

Tara writes, “The Yearbook club needs digital cameras to shoot the activities of 2015-2016 school year. The Yearbook serves as the preservation of the school year and all of the activities that make our Mission HS a great community.”

Mission High Student Benefit

Students will learn the basics of being a digital photographer as they take photos of school events and the methods of preserving them in a yearbook form. Working on the yearbook will give them leadership and collaboration skills to strengthen their lives in the 21st century.

SPARK Grant Award

$1000 to be used for 8 Canon SX150is, which has easy to use manual settings for a beginning photographer.

Anita Feingold-Shaw

The Need

Anita writes, “I would like to request traditional board games as well as word games which build literacy and language. Playing games will foster community among students from different countries who may not speak the same language. Language games such as Scrabble and Boggle will allow students to further explore their second language, English.”

Mission High Student Benefit

Students will learn the basics of being a digital photographer as they take photos of school events and the methods of preserving them in a yearbook form. Working on the yearbook will give them leadership and collaboration skills to strengthen their lives in the 21st century.

SPARK Grant Award

$500 to be used on board games including Scrabble, Boggle,Jenga, Connect 4, Skattegories Jr, and many, many more!

Karin Kussmann

The Need

Karin writes, “As the teacher of novice language learners, I spend much of my time helping students learn and apply language-learning strategies to a variety of task, including reading. One of the important reading strategies that students use is to look for vocabulary that they do know, then look at vocabulary they do not know and try to make guesses on that meaning based on context. In order to facilitate this strategy's implementation, I am proposing to receive textbooks designed for novice Spanish readers and a document projector to allow the class to read and review the materials collectively.”

Mission High Student Benefit

Students of all grades, backgrounds and abilities are enrolled in the course. The class is focused on acquisition-based learning through the use of strategies and practice in multiple contexts. By differentiating how students access and use the language they learn, the teacher is able to make Spanish accessible and valuable to all learners.

SPARK Grant Award

$500 to fund Elmo MO-1 Visual Presenter for use in the classroom in order to display reading resources and two Spanish text books Todas las Voces A1/A2, B1 and, Obejtivo DELE .
